creditline: Gift of funds from the Weiser Family Foundation
dimension: 2 13/16 x 1 9/16 x 3/16 in. (7.14 x 3.97 x 0.48 cm) (including pendants)
text: The Hamsa (five) hand is a common motif in Jewish iconography but is not necessarily Jewish in origin. In fact, the open hand, often with an embedded eye, as a protective talisman against the Evil Eye dates back to ancient Mesopotamia.  This example includes a bird with a gemstone eye. In Arab cultures the symbol is known as the Hand of Fatima, a reference to the Prophet Muhammad's daughter. The Hamsa symbol has spread in popularity as a good luck symbol for many cultures.
title: Hamsa amulet
